triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: Large language models are the core technology integrated into agent-based modeling and simulation systems discussed throughout this survey.

triples.name: Agent-based model
triples.relevance: Agent-based modeling is the primary simulation methodology that the survey examines when enhanced with large language models.

triples.name: Complex system
triples.relevance: Complex systems are the domain that agent-based modeling and simulation aim to understand through emergent interactions.

triples.name: Emergence
triples.relevance: Emergence describes how higher-level behaviors arise from lower-level agent interactions, a key phenomenon in agent-based simulations.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: Intelligent agents are the autonomous entities in agent-based models that interact with their environment and each other.

triples.name: Computer simulation
triples.relevance: Computer simulation is the computational technique underlying agent-based modeling and enables the execution of complex multi-agent systems.
